alert.note: Alert for Eastern San Miguel County; Northeast Highlands (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 27 at 9:58PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF CENTRAL SAN MIGUEL COUNTY THROUGH 1015 PM MDT... At 958 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 12 miles south of Trujillo, or 29 miles north of Santa Rosa, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of central San Miguel County. This includes State Road 104 between Mile Markers 37 and 44. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building.

area.areaDesc: Eastern San Miguel County; Northeast Highlands
